name: Scrolr
body:
### What is this?
Scrolr is a Chrome extension which will change the way we browse the Internet. At present, we need to physically use a mouse or keyboard to scroll or interact with a webpage; however, with scrolr we can use our body gestures for doing the same thing without any external hardware like Leap Motion or Kinect!

### Features
* Tilt your head up and down for scrolling pages up and down.
* Move head slightly left and right for horizontal scrolling.
* Toggle the app with the click of a button.

### Upcoming
* Move head left and right for going back and forward.
* Use hands for 'pinch and zoom' feature on the webpage.

**NOTE: Not all of these features have been implemented yet.**

### Nerdy Details

#### Backend
Coded in C++, uses [OpenCV](http://opencv.org/) (an open source computer vision library) for facial recognition and tracking.
Frames are obtained one at a time, allowing the frontend to update the calculated face position as often
(or as seldom) as necessary. 

#### Frontend
A Chrome Extension which relies JavaScript for interaction between the users and the feature detection software. [NPAPI](http://developer.chrome.com/extensions/npapi.html) is used to execute the C++ code in user's Chrome web browser as an extension. [Google Native Client](https://developers.google.com/native-client/) was not used for it's lack of webcam support.
